com.avnera.smartdigitalheadset

Interface LightX.Delegate

  • Enclosing class:
    LightX

    public static interface LightX.Delegate
    The LightX.Delegate interface defines methods that will be called from a LightX instance to inform an interested object (typically the entity that creates the LightX class) of changes to the LightX instance's state.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void lightXAppReadResult(LightX lightX, Command command, boolean success, byte[] buffer)
      A LightX instance calls lightXAppReadResult() to return the result of read command initiated by calling readApp()

      A LightX instance calls lightXAppReceivedPush() when a "push" packet is received from the application firmware.
      void lightXAppWriteResult(LightX lightX, Command command, boolean success)
      A LightX instance calls lightXAppWriteResult() to return the result of a write command initiated by calling one of the writeApp*() methods.
      void lightXError(LightX lightX, Exception exception)
      A LightX instance calls lightXError() when an error occurs during command processing.
      boolean lightXFirmwareReadStatus(LightX lightX, LightX.FirmwareRegion region, int offset, byte[] buffer)
      lightXFirmwareReadStatus() delivers data initiated by a call to readFirmware().

      During a firmware write operation, the LightX delegate is called back with progress updates of each operation (see the documentation for LightX.FirmwareWriteOperation).
      void lightXIsInBootloader(LightX lightX, boolean isInBootloader)
      A LightX instance calls lightXIsInBootloader() to indicate whether the device is executing bootloader code.
      void lightXReadConfigResult(LightX lightX, Command command, boolean success, String value)
      A LightX instance calls lightXAppReadResult() to return the result of a read command initiated by calling one of the readConfig* or readApp* methods.
      boolean lightXWillRetransmit(LightX lightX, Command command)
      lightXWillRetransmit() notifies the delegate that the LightX command-write thread is going to retransmit a command to the LightX hardware (occurs when no response is received after sending a command and a timeout expires) and gives the delegate the opportunity to abort the retransmit operation.

    • Method Detail

      • lightXAppReadResult

        void lightXAppReadResult(LightX lightX,
                         Command command,
                         boolean success,
                         byte[] buffer)
        A LightX instance calls lightXAppReadResult() to return the result of read command initiated by calling readApp()
        Parameters:
        lightX - The LightX instance calling lightXAppReadResult()
        command - The command for which data is being returned
        success - true if the read request succeeded, false otherwise. When false, buffer is null.
        buffer - The raw buffer returned by the application firmware. The content of this buffer depends on the associated app command.

      • lightXAppReceivedPush

        void lightXAppReceivedPush(LightX lightX,
                           Command command,
                           byte[] data)
        A LightX instance calls lightXAppReceivedPush() when a "push" packet is received from the application firmware. A push is any packet with a command value in the range 0xC0 <= value <= 0xFF, and are typically generated asynchronously by sensors (e.g. accelerometer, etc.).
        Parameters:
        lightX - The LightX instance calling lightXAppReceivedPush()
        command - The push command for which data is being returned
        data - A buffer containing data associated with the push command. The content of this buffer depends on the associated push command.

      • lightXAppWriteResult

        void lightXAppWriteResult(LightX lightX,
                          Command command,
                          boolean success)
        A LightX instance calls lightXAppWriteResult() to return the result of a write command initiated by calling one of the writeApp*() methods.
        Parameters:
        lightX - The LightX instance calling lightXWriteResult()
        command - The command for which data is being returned
        success - true if the write request succeeded, false otherwise

      • lightXError

        void lightXError(LightX lightX,
                 Exception exception)
        A LightX instance calls lightXError() when an error occurs during command processing. Errors can be generated by a variety of conditions, examples of which include (but are not limited to) socket failure errors, loss of connectivity, retransmit errors, etc. The LightX class is designed to be as resilient as possible to transitory errors. For this reason when lightXError() is called there is a more than good chance the error is unrecoverable. Typically the delegate receiving this message will close() the lightX instance and allow it to be deallocated, then create another instance when resources again become available (such as a Bluetooth device coming into range and regaining a connection).
        Parameters:
        lightX - The LightX instance calling lightXError()
        exception - An exception with associated message that comes closest to the problem condition. The exception is meant to be advisory only.

      • lightXFirmwareReadStatus

        boolean lightXFirmwareReadStatus(LightX lightX,
                                 LightX.FirmwareRegion region,
                                 int offset,
                                 byte[] buffer)
        lightXFirmwareReadStatus() delivers data initiated by a call to readFirmware(). This callback will be called repeatedly with small chunks of data until the entire size requested readFirmware() is delivered.
        Parameters:
        lightX - The LightX instance calling lightXReadRegion()
        region - The firmware region from which the delivered data comes.
        offset - The offset in bytes from the start of the firmware region where buffer starts.
        buffer - The firmware data that starts at region[ offset ].
        Returns:
        Return true to abort reading of the data region, false otherwise.

      • lightXFirmwareWriteStatus

        boolean lightXFirmwareWriteStatus(LightX lightX,
                                  LightX.FirmwareRegion region,
                                  LightX.FirmwareWriteOperation operation,
                                  double progress,
                                  Exception exception)
        During a firmware write operation, the LightX delegate is called back with progress updates of each operation (see the documentation for LightX.FirmwareWriteOperation).
        Parameters:
        lightX - The LightX instance calling lightXFirmwareWriteStatus()
        region - The firmware region being updated (either Application or Resource)
        operation - The current firmware write operation (e.g. Erase, Write, etc.)
        progress - A value between 0 and 1.0 indicating the progress of the current operation.
        exception - During normal operation this parameter will be null. When the write completes, lightXFirmwareWriteStatus() will be called with an operation of FirmwareWriteOperation.Complete. At that time, if the exception parameter is non-null, then the firmware write operation failed, and the exception will indicate the failure reason.
        Returns:
        Return true to abort the current firmware write operation. Note that doing so may leave the firmware region in an incomplete and inconsistent state. Aborting is probably only useful during debugging and testing as firmware writing over Bluetooth can be a slow operation. In almost all cases you should return false from lightXFirmwareWriteStatus() which allows the firmware write operation to continue.

      • lightXIsInBootloader

        void lightXIsInBootloader(LightX lightX,
                          boolean isInBootloader)
        A LightX instance calls lightXIsInBootloader() to indicate whether the device is executing bootloader code. This method will be called whenever the LightX connection state changes to connected and when the state transitions to bootloader or application mode.
        Parameters:
        lightX - The LightX instance calling lightXIsInBootloader()
        isInBootloader - A boolean value indicating whether the hardware is currently executing bootloader code (true) or application code (false).

      • lightXReadConfigResult

        void lightXReadConfigResult(LightX lightX,
                            Command command,
                            boolean success,
                            String value)
        A LightX instance calls lightXAppReadResult() to return the result of a read command initiated by calling one of the readConfig* or readApp* methods.
        Parameters:
        lightX - The LightX instance calling lightXAppReadResult()
        command - The command for which data is being returned
        success - true if the write request succeeded, false otherwise. When false, buffer is null.
        value - If

      • lightXWillRetransmit

        boolean lightXWillRetransmit(LightX lightX,
                             Command command)
        lightXWillRetransmit() notifies the delegate that the LightX command-write thread is going to retransmit a command to the LightX hardware (occurs when no response is received after sending a command and a timeout expires) and gives the delegate the opportunity to abort the retransmit operation.
        Parameters:
        lightX - The LightX instance calling lightXReceivedAppPush()
        command - The command that will be retransmitted
        Returns:
        return true to abort the retransmit operation, false to allow the retransmit
